section.title: Disabling the Internal Administrative User
section.para: You can disable users on the local domains including the admin@internal user created during engine-setup. Make sure you have at least one user in the envrionment with full administrative permissions before disabling the default admin user.

step.para: Log in to the machine on which the Red Hat Virtualization Manager is installed.
Make sure another user with the SuperUser role has been added to the environment. See for more information.

note.para: To enable a disabled user, run ovirt-aaa-jdbc-tool user edit username --flag=-disabled
